reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Poopally's is a heritage homestay a few kilometres away from Allepeye, Kerala. The homestay is run by a friendly elderly couple who make you feel very much at home. The rates they do come as full or half board but the location offers little other options. The garden at the homestay backs on to the backwaters and allows you to relax in peace. The food was generally of good quality, freshly prepared every day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We don't normally go for homestays as when we are on holiday we like to keep to ourselves, so by the time we got to Pooppalleys we were slightly nervous. We needn't have worried however, we were in the hands of a real pro and within minutes of arriving, Dr Joseph Pooppally had admonished our absolutely insane taxi driver for overcharging us, swept us inside, offered us tea and given us the low-down on his home. Dr Joseph is in his 70's but thanks to a strict vegetarian diet and daily yoga for many years, is as spritely as most 50 year olds - he is also a mine of information on everything from local politics to where to book a boat trip. His home is beautiful - over 100 years old and built in the traditional Kerelan style with lots of wood. The guests are lodged in equally old bungalows on the waterfront a small distance from the house so we had some privacy and would while away the evenings before dinner reading and watching the water traffic chug past. Dinner was sumptous and varied every night - Dr joseph's wife is a quiet and kindly lady who just happens to be a superb cook. We also found it interesting to chat to the other guests as we all ate together and the conversation flowed apace aided by Dr Joseph's homemade Nutmeg wine! We didn't have time to do a boat trip as well so but Dr Joseph arranged for a 2 hr trip in a smaller motor boat that took us down some tiny backwaters where we got to see much, much more than if we'd been on a big rice barge. I feel if you want a genuine homestay right on the backwaters then this is the real deal. I really cannot speak highly enough of this wonderful couple who have opened their home and made an absolutely one off experience accessable to so many.
reviews.title: Beautiful Home Stay right on the backwaters

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay with Dr Joseph and his family, booked on the basis of the favourable reviews on Tripadvisor. Pooppally's is a beautiful traditional Keralan home on the riverbank. It's a very tranquil and peaceful setting, and the cottage we stayed in was very clean and comfortable. Dr Joseph is exceptionally kind and warm-hearted, and we were very well looked after. It is worth coming here for the food alone - it's incredible! The only downside (if you could call it that!) is that the amount of food prepared for us was way more than we could possibly eat, and we did feel bad that we couldn't do it justice. We stayed two nights, and would highly recommend it for a relaxing break. If you like five star impersonal hotels, then this probably isn't for you, but if you're interested in experiencing a little of rural Keralan life with a charming family, then I think you can't do better than to stay here.
reviews.title: Relaxing, peaceful and comfortable homestay

likes.disliked: — Far too much food - we ached. Didn't have up to date ferry timetable - we missed our ferry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at Pooppally's and had a wonderful time. It was great value for money as the meals were included in the room price. In addition Dr Joseph arranged all our sightseeing activities in Kerela including a houseboat, massages, motor boat sight seeing and taxis and negotiated a reasonable price on our behalf. What made this place so outstanding for us was the exceptional hospitality. Dr Joseph, Cicily and Lisa always ensured that we were comfortable and all our needs met. We had wonderful conversations over our meals and were taken for a walk around their beautiful garden. I highly recommend this homestay, it is a tropical paradise where you can truly relax.
reviews.title: Best destination in India

reviews.text: I booked 2 days at the Pooppallys' wonderful home in the "Backwaters" near Alleppey as a short break in the middle of a business trip to Pune and Bangalore. This was influenced by some glowing Trip Advisor reviews and an informative web site. The old Keralan cottage (Deluxe Room) I stayed in was very comfortable and the solar heating provided ample hot water. The meals were excellent and varied. The location is exceptional right on the banks of a wide river with lots of interesting wildlife to watch including kingfishers and various birds of prey. I took the local ferry into Alleppey, which at 6Rs for the 1.5 hour journey is an increditable bargain and great fun. One of the most amazing sights was watching hundreds of ducks with a mind of their own being marshalled up and down the river by 3 men punting in canoes! The Backwaters is a lovely peaceful area and I felt a million miles away from urban India. I travelled to Pooppallys by pre-paid taxi from Cochin Airport and Mr Pooppally arranged a car to take me back to the airport including a short tour of Fort Cochin which is worth seeing.
reviews.title: Highly recommended - lovely people and location
